snippet: The Commerce Department raised its estimate on economic growth, and a Federal Reserve report said that manufacturing is rising throughout the country.
abstract: Commerce Department says economy grew at a 3 percent annual rate in fourth-quarter 2011, compared with growth rate of 1.8 percent in the third quarter; economists project economy will grow about 2.5 percent for 2012; survey of regional economic conditions in Federal Reserve's 12 districts finds most experienced modest growth.
lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department raised its estimate on economic growth, and a Federal Reserve report said that manufacturing is rising throughout the country.

headline.main: Year-End Economic Data Points to a Better 2012
headline.print_headline: Year-End Economic Data Points to a Better 2012
